lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Hoshi.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Hoshi.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Hoshi is a user-friendly chatbot that keeps tracks of your todos, events and deadlines!
It is  currently still in development and features are yet to be finalized.
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* This class represents a Deadline with a description, completion status and end time.

*

This class inherits from the Task class It maintains a description
* of the deadline, whether the task has been completed or not and the end time.
* Constructs a new instance of Event.
* @param endTime String end time of Event.
* Returns a string representation of the task.

*

The string includes the status icon and the description of the task.
* @return A string in the format {"[statusIcon] description"}.
* This class represents an Event with a description, completion status, start time and end time.

*

This class inherits from the Task class It maintains a description
* of the event, whether the event has been completed or not and its start and end time
* Constructs a new instance of Event.
* @param startTime String start time of Event.
* @param endTime String end time of Event.
public Event(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {
* Returns a string representation of the to do.

*

The string includes the E identifier , status icon and the description of the to do.
* @return A string in the format {" "[E]" + [statusIcon] description + " (from: " + startTime + " to: " + endTime + " ) "}.
Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);  // Create a Scanner object
System.out.println("Hoshi doesn't have anything stored! Please add a task first");
System.out.println("Please specify the task number to mark!");
// get only the number from the 2nd half of the splitInput
// if specified index is not out of bounds
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: \n");
throw new HoshiException("Hoshi doesn't have such a task!");
System.out.println("Please specify the task number to unmark! \n");
// get only the number from the 2nd half of the splitInput
// if specified index is not out of bounds
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n");
throw new HoshiException("Hoshi doesn't have such a task! \n");
System.out.println("Please specify the task number to delete! \n");
// get only the number from the 2nd half of the splitInput
System.out.println("Please specify the task to add! E.g. Add {task to be added} \n");
throw new HoshiException("Hoshi dosen't understand! Is input empty? \n");
throw new HoshiException("Hoshi dosen't understand! Is input empty? \n");
System.out.println("When would you like your Deadline to be due by? ");
throw new HoshiException("Hoshi doesn't understand! Is input empty? \n");
System.out.println("When would you like your Event to start? ");
System.out.println("When would you like your Event to end? ");
Event newEvent = new Event(desc, startTime, endTime);
System.out.println("Hoshi doesn't understand! Please try again with the above keywords");
System.out.println("Hoshi doesn't understand, try a different input? ");
* Prints bye message when user terminates the program
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\s
* Exception class for handling errors specific to Hoshi.
* Constructs a new instance of HoshiException with the specified error message.
* @param message The error message which will be shown if user encounters the relevant error
* This class represents an abstract task with a description and completion status.

*

This class serves as a base class for 3 types of tasks. It maintains a description
* of said task and whether the task has been completed or not.
* Constructs a new instance of Task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Returns a string representation of the task.

*

The string includes the status icon and the description of the task.
* @return A string in the format {"[statusIcon] description"}.
* This class represents a "to do" with a description and completion status.

*

This class inherits from the Task class It maintains a description
* of a to do and whether the task has been completed or not.
* Constructs a new instance of to do.
* Returns a string representation of the to do.

*

The string includes the E identifier , status icon and the description of the to do.
* @return A string in the format {" "[T]" + [statusIcon] description"}.
